page.title: 06 MEDIA
page.content: Although it is in Wales, the Beguildy Parish is served by the Midlands Television Transmitter, so it is impossible to receive B.B.C. Wales or H.T.V. Wales. All of the national newspapers are delivered daily to the village shops in Beguildy and Felindre. The evening paper, which is also delivered daily,is the Shropshire Star.The local weekly papers are the Mid Wales Journal, which has a local press officer and therefore contains much local news, the County Times and Gazette and the Brecon and Radnor Times. It is possible to obtain a wide variety of stations on the radio but the reception for all Welsh transmissions is poor. A parish magazine is produced once a month which contains items of parish news and a wide variety of interesting articles.
